title: Defrosting Ground Turkey Safely

items.name: Microwave method (fastest)
items.details: Remove packaging, place on microwave-safe plate. Use defrost setting or 30% power for 2-3 minutes, flipping halfway. Cook immediately after.

items.name: Cold water method (moderate speed)
items.details: Keep turkey in sealed packaging or leak-proof bag. Submerge in cold water, changing water every 30 minutes. Thaws in about 1 hour. Cook right after.

items.name: Fridge method (safest)
items.details: Place in a bowl or tray to catch drips. Leave in fridge overnight (12-24 hours). Can stay in fridge for up to 2 days before cooking.

items.name: Counter defrosting
items.details: Never defrost on the counter - the temperature danger zone promotes bacterial growth.

notes: Microwave defrosting is safe as long as you cook immediately afterward. The microwave can cause parts to start cooking while other parts are still frozen, creating a temperature zone where bacteria can multiply if left to sit.
